   (i) LASU requires 'O' level credit passes in Mathematics 
and Christian Religious Studies.  
(ii) ABU accepts one (1)other Social Science subject in lieu 
of an Art subject.  
(iii) ABSU requires five (5) 'O' level credit passes to include 
English Language, Religious Studies and three (3) other 
subjects.  
(iv) CALABAR requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes 
including English Language, Religious Studies and three 
(3) other Arts subjects. It accepts 'O' level pass in 
Mathematics.  
(v) TASUED requires five (5) or six (6) 'O' level credit passes 
at one (1) or two (2) sittings to include English Language 
and other subjects in Arts or Social Sciences.  
(vi) KSU and OAU require five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes or TC 
II merits including English Language, Christian Religious 
Studiesand three (3)other relevant subjects.  
(vii) LAGOS requires five (5) 'O' level  credit passes including 
English Language, Mathematics, Christian Religious Studies 
and any two (2) of Literature inEnglish, any Nigerian  
Language,  History/Government,  French, 
Economics/Commerce, Geography, Civic Education/Social 
Studies.  
(viii) EBSU requires five (5) 'O' level  credit passes  to include 
Christian Religious Studies, Islamic Studies at not more 
than two (2) sittings.  
(ix) ABUJA  also  requires  'O'  level 
 credit  pass  in Mathematics.  
(x) AAUA requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes or T C II 
merits in five (5) subjects including English Language, 
Mathematics, Christian Religious Studies/Islamic 
Studies and any two (2) from Yoruba, Government, 
Arabic/French.  
  
UTME SUBJECTS  
(i) OAU requires Religious Studies and any two(2) of History, 
Yoruba, Music, French, Fine Arts, Literature in English 
and Government.
